channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report E-2024070119
item.description:
Report E-2024070119

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-10T18:16:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-06
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 6, 2024, at 0455 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Romeoville, Illinois regarding the release of Methyl Ethyl Ketone. ERTS was informed terminal personnel discovered a release of a 1 cup of Methyl Ethyl Ketone (UN1193, 3, II) from (1) 5-gallon DM that impacted a concrete dock. Terminal personnel were able to clean the release with absorbents and place the damaged pail and spent absorbents in a 5-gallon DM for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024070451
item.description:
Report X-2024070451

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-10T18:16:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-04
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was immediately called out as a Damaged HazMat by RORS Unload Manager Grant. Package was immediately taken to the Hazmat cage for isolation and processing. Neutralizer was also put down on a small spill of Sulfuric Acid on the floor near bank 3, door 1 for safety reasons. Items had absolutely no seals underneath their caps. Please use seals to prevent leaks on bottles, especially when transporting dangerous and hazardous material.

item.title: Report X-2024070296
item.description:
Report X-2024070296

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UNLOADER SAW THE PACKAGE ON THE GROUND, INSIDE THE TRAILER LEAKING. NOTIFIED SUPERVISOR WHO NOTIFIED UPS RESPONDERS. RESPONDER ARRIVED TO THE SPILL, SOLIDIFIED THE SPILL ON THE GROUND, AND TOOK THE PACKAGE TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. A FELLOW RESPONDER BAGGED AND TAGGED THE REMAINS OF THE MATERIAL, AND HAVE CONTACTED VIOLIA FOR FURTHER INSTRUCTIONS.

item.title: Report E-2024070047
item.description:
Report E-2024070047

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: SAUGET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: An employee noticed leakage/wet spot under a trailer that was parked at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Sauget, IL. Employees began offloading the trailer to find the leaking drum. Once identified, the leaked material was cleaned with absorbents. The drum had a pinhole leak in the bottom causing the material to slowly leak out of the drum. No injuries or chemical exposures were reported. The drum was overpacked for continued transportation.

item.title: Report E-2024070028
item.description:
Report E-2024070028

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-20
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 20, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon pail of paint was crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) quart of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel collected one (1) damaged one-gallon jug of UN3469 for disposal. Crews then utilized absorbent pads to collect the released UN3469 that had not yet evaporated. All UN3469 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070037
item.description:
Report E-2024070037

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-14
  • City: DOLTON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The driver arrived at his destination where he noticed liquid dripping from trailer the driver then put down some absorbent pads and notified the facility. The onsite team and created a containment and then preceded to get a team together to enter the trailer. They were eventually able to get a crew that was trained to enter the trailer. The team showed up at 0830 to begin unloading and cleaning up any residue as needed. The crew discovered a drum with a pin hole they removed the lid and discovered that it was mostly full of wags and very little liquid. We believe that the wrags were blocking the hole and when in transit they would move around allowing it to leek ocasinaly. The crew then placed it into a salvage drum and cleaned up and disposed of the adsorbents and rags used properly. the clean up was completed by 1130.

item.title: Report E-2024070057
item.description:
Report E-2024070057

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-12
  • City: CHICAGO HEIGHTS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 0.5-ounce of 2-Methoxyethoxymethyl chloride (hazardous - UN2810) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the outside containers. The terminal requested a contractor out for cleanup and containment. ERTS dispatched SET Environmental to assist with cleanup. The product release was contained to the damaged drum and all other drums were confirmed secured. All other drums were secured to the pallet and will continue to the destination. The leaking drum was overpacked into a 55-gallon metal drum for disposal.
